The Movita is suitable for indoor and outdoor use and differs from similar walkers on the market, because of it's slightly inclined frame which creates greater user stability. The Movita trunk units can also be interchanged quickly and easily.
Accessories Include: Foot Separator, Knee Separator, Foot Rest, Anti-tipping System, Directional Locking Wheels, Roll-off Frame Wheels, Variable Damping Springs.

La hipertensión arterial es el principal factor de riesgo para padecer enfermedades cardiovasculares, que constituyen la primera causa de muerte. Sin embargo, existe una gran disparidad  en el número de personas que conocen  su condición de hipertenso, los que reciben tratamiento y no están controlados y los que reciben tratamiento y están controlados. Ello hace necesario impulsar los esfuerzos para aumentar la concientización y conocimiento sobre la hipertensión y las iniciativas para facilitar el acceso a tratamiento adecuado y basado en la evidencia.
.
Como cada 17 de mayo, la Organización Mundial de la Salud se une a la comunidad mundial para conmemorar el Día Mundial de la Hipertensión como una oportunidad para insistir en la necesidad de trabajar en la prevención y control de la hipertensión, con el fin de prevenir muertes por enfermedades cardiovasculares.
.

What a great shot of the scalp during a traumatic craniofacial reconstruction surgery! 🤕
.
The scalp is what covers the calvaria, which is made up of the superior portions of the frontal bone, occipital bone, and parietal bones. It lies from the superior nuchal lines to posteriorly to the supraorbital margins anteriorly. It is composed of 5 layers coincidentally remembered by the acronym SCALP: 😜
.
-Skin layer (contains hair and sebaceous glands)
-Connective tissue layer of fibrofatty tissue (fat)
-Aponeurotic layer (flat, broad tendons)
-Loose areolar tissue layer
-Pericranium (outermost layer of bone of skull)
.
The scalp is supplied arterially through an anastomotic network of blood vessels whose names are based off of their location on the skull which include: supratrochlear, supraorbital, superficial temporal, posterior auricular, and occipital arteries. ❤️
.
Venous drainage includes: supratrochlear, supraorbital, superficial temporal, posterior auricular, and occipital veins. 💙
.
The sensory neurological supply is also named very similarly and includes: supratochlear, supraorbital, zygomaticotemporal, auriculotemporal, lesser occipital, greater occipital, & 3rd occipital nerves. ⚡️
.
Clinical Relevance: Wounds in the scalp bleed profusely, because the fibrous fascia prevents vasoconstriction. However, wounds superficial to the aponeurosis gap much less than do wounds that cut through it, because aponeurosis holds the skin tight. The emissary veins do not have valves and open in the loose areolar tissue; therefore, infection can be transmitted from the scalp directly into the cranial cavity. The layer of loose areolar tissue is known as the dangerous area of the scalp. 😷
.
If you or a loved one feel like they may be experiencing these symptoms please ask us and contact your primary healthcare physician to prevent further complications. Stay cool and stay healthy everyone! 😎
.
Want to learn about more interesting anatomy and medical conditions like these? FOLLOW US and TAG YOUR FRIENDS! You never know who is need of your knowledge! 🤓
.

We know some people wish to have more hair while others wish to have less. But it's safe to say that no one wants to grow hair directly on their eyeballs! This interesting case is due to a benign tumor, known as a limbal dermoid, found in a 19 year old Iranian man. He claimed it was present since birth and gradually grew in size to about 5mm in diameter. Soon after several black hairs began to sprout. He decided to seek medical attention once he began experiencing mild discomfort and vision loss. It was later surgically removed. Limbal Dermoid: rare, benign congenital tumor in the Cornea limbus of the eye containing choristomatous tissue This type of tissue consists of microscopically normal tissue derived from germ cell layers foreign to that body site. Most of this type of tissue contains hair follicles but can also contain skin, fat, sweat glands, muscle, and even neurologic tissue! Most people can live with it and do not need surgical intervention unless it begins to effect daily activities such as the lranian man was experiencing. Since it is congenital not much can be done to prevent although some epibulbar dermoids have been related to maternal ingestion of teratogenic agents. If you or a loved one feel you may have a limbal dermoid, contact your primary healthcare physician for more options. Stay optically hairless and stay healthy everyone!!! Enjoyed the post? Want to learn about more interesting cases and conditions? Medicine is wonderful and so are you! Just FOLLOW us and request something you'd like to learn about to be featured in our next post! #limbaldermoid #rareconditions #clinical #medical #men #women #hospital #medicine #surgery #eyes #hair #hairy #anatomy #love #tumor #vision #blind #tissue #science #fetus #humanbody #natural #baby #teenagers #people #med school #med #dc

・・・
Equine Medicine - here is a 4 step photo guide demonstrating how to apply urethane polymer to support the hooves when managing a case of laminitis. If the frogs of the hooves are not given adequate support the pedal bones are at risk of penetrating the soles of the feet and the horse will have to be euthanised. 
1) Leaving the shoe on clean the foot thoroughly and dry it. Here we are using a blowtorch to ensure the foot is clean and dry. In particularly painful cases of laminitis an abaxial sesamoid nerve block may be necessary to make the horse comfortable enough to pick its feet up from the ground. 
2) Pack the toe of the foot with Play-Doh so the urethane polymer is only applied to the frog and back half of the sole. Hold the foot level to the ground and apply the polymer liquid around the frog and back half of the sole. The polymer will set quickly. 
3) Allow to set. 
4) Remove the Play-Doh from the toe. 
Laminitis is not a disease in itself but a symptom of a disease. It is therefore very important that the underlying disease causing the laminitis is addressed. In this case an overweight horse is suffering from equine metabolic syndrome (EMS) so a low sugar diet and weight loss are as essential to resolving this case as good foot management. Laminitis is also a symptom of Cushings Syndrome (PPID) which must be addressed if present.
